casebody.data:
Hector JIMENEZ-SALES, Appellant/Petitioner(s),
v.
STATE of Florida, Appellee/Respondent(s). CASE NO.: 2D18-2025 District Court of Appeal of Florida, Second District. December 21, 2018

BY ORDER OF THE COURT:

The petition for belated appeal is granted in circuit court case number 2016-CF-1822. This order shall serve as a timely notice of appeal from the judgment and sentence, the latter imposed March 5, 2018. Within twenty days the trial court shall consider appellant's eligibility for appointment of appellate counsel, provided appellant files within ten days a motion in the circuit court requesting same accompanied by a financial affidavit, and shall enter an order thereupon, with a copy to appellant and a copy to this court.

The circuit court clerk shall treat this order as a notice of appeal, promptly certify same and return it to this court as with any notice of appeal, accompanied by any order of indigency that may have been entered by the circuit court, and a new appellate case number will be assigned to this appeal and an acknowledgment letter will issue at that time. Petitioner's motion for reconsideration and motion for judicial notice are denied as moot.

The commissioner's motion for extension of time is granted to the extent that the report and recommendation are accepted as timely filed.

CASANUEVA, LUCAS, and ROTHSTEIN-YOUAKIM, JJ., Concur.
